intro: Homalanthus vernicosus, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, flat seeds. The plant is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
